subject: Documenting test cases
msgSnippet: When writing test cases my fingers automatically type: public void testTheMethodBeingTested() throws Exception { } Is it acceptable to write throws
messageBody:
When writing test cases my fingers automatically type:

public void testTheMethodBeingTested() throws Exception {
}

Is it acceptable to write "throws Exception"? Or should I
1. Only declare thrown exceptions I expect
2. Not declare anything thrown
3. Other

Thanks
--David Plass


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
